4g lysine    (PureBulk)
2g arginine  (PureBulk)
2g glycine   (PureBulk)
2g IP6       (Source Naturals SN1366)
1g histidine (PureBulk)
1g cystiene  (PureBulk)


Vitamins and Minerals

1g magnesium bis glycinate    (NuSci 3344-18-1)
1g sodium citrate             (Loud Wolf 6132-04-3)
0.5g potassium gluconate      (Purebulk)
0.2g potassium iodide KI      (PureBulk)
0.3g (1cap) zinc citrate      (Swanson SW1234)
0.3g (1 cap) selenium         (Swanson SWU171)
0.34g (1 cap) thiamine        (Natures Way BLK8382)
0.36 (1 cap) biotin           (Now Foods 0469B)
0.7g (1 cap) pantothenic acid (Now Foods 0486)
0.5g (1 cap) Niacinamide      (Purebulk)


Essential Oils and Carrier Oils

20 drops vitamin D3/K2          (Thorne KD500)
140 *drops coconut        (Garden of Life)

entry.title: TEEF Powder 4.6 recipe
entry.content:
Try Latest TEEF Free! 

For a while now the batch number is located on the back of the bag, on the bottom of the ingredients label in parenthesis.  Looks like: (4.5)

Neem 5 was 6.  Lowered to reduce bitterness.

Lavender 30 was 26.  Boosted to offset metallic taste caused by raising thyme and oregano.

Thyme and Oregano both 13 were 12.  Boosted to further fight plaque by reducing actinomyces bacteria.

Atlas Cedarwood 18 was 17.  Added to also help reduce metallic taste and also prevent tooth looseness.  Since this reduces campylobacter (also ginger, tagetes, and patchouli do as well) that causes tooth looseness, it may cause tooth uncomfortability caused by h pylori which grows when campy is absent.  Things that help against h pylori are mastic and carrot and myrrh and coconut oil.

Juniper berry 25 was 23, boosted to help prevent tongue twitching due to tetanus bacteria, but oregano and thyme also probably help control it.

entry.title: TEEF Powder 4.4 Recipe
entry.content:
Try Latest TEEF Free! 

We currently still use plastic bags on our product (you can request plastic free which uses no bag currently) but within the next few batches we will be moving to 100% plastic-free!  For our film bags we received a plant-based biofilm that is 100% compostable at home.  It will decompose naturally in the soil and leave no plastic waste in the dumps or oceans, and at the same time keep TEEF sealed and fresh for years.

Teeth hurt with 4.3, sensitive to cold.  Must be I didn't put the correct # drops of cinnamon essential oil.  To be safe I am going to bump it up a couple anyway.  Peppermint also helps fight this bacteria.

Cinnamon 20 was 18
peppermint 122 was 120
eucalyptus 23 was 22, raised due to dry tongue, kind of astringent I think it was mycoplasma which usually causes dry mouth.

Gives a very slight cinnamon forward taste now.

HAPPEN method updated to add nHApP before the base so that the peroxide can create some water moisture to allow better emulsification.  In the future an alternative is to add a little mist of water.  This would be better than letting the peroxide create the water because we want the peroxide to be preserved.  But also water is not ideal in the system so ideally the HAPPEN would be made separately with a moist process then dried before combining with TEEF.

entry.title: TEEF 4.3
entry.content:
Try Latest TEEF Free! 

120 peppermint was 114. Added to help flavor since it is quite lemony currently. 13 sweet orange was 15. Lowered due to flavor. Lecithin and MCT removed, both contributed to tooth infection due to lipid and phospholipid degrading bacteria (serratia) Also dark lecithin contributes to less white teeth. Lets see if with no lecithin and with new remineralizer we can keep shiny smoothe teeth. Future may use (very little like 0.5g per batch to prevent feeding serratia, which is also suppressed with lemongrass and orange and frankisence essential oil) lecithin concentrate which is white and a powder. Teeth are strong but a little less smooth than when lecithin was used. 180 coconut was 120. Bossted to help compensate for loss of MCT Future also use cellulose nanocrystals to help keep eo's from evaporating even better. Full Batch Recipe: Makes 15 x 70g packs and 4 x 20g pack. entry.content:
Try Latest TEEF Free!

 3g sunflower lecithin was 12.  lowered because lecithin supports serratia and other oil eating bacteria that cause damaged teeth to develop pain in the pulp. But we do need lecithin to emulsify remineralizers and prevent buildup on teeth.

Orange 15 was 20
Lemongrass 13 was 14.

These oils were toned down because lecithin which supports serratia growth was lessened.

31 proline was 30.  Boosted to help reduce dryness of powder in the mouth.

entry.title: TEEF Powder 4.1
entry.content:
Try Latest TEEF Free!

Coconut 120 was 80 (boosting oils to reduce dust since introducing nano remineralizer)
MCT 60 was 40
ginseng 45 was 40
20% boost to all eo's!
12g sunflower lecithin was 5.  Boosted to help emulsify better.  Also now makes mix 1oz so can be sold separately as mouthwash.

Orange 20 was 10
Lemongrass 14 was 12.

These essential oil changes were to moderate the pro-oil eating bacteria like serratia that cause tooth pain.  The best essential oil agains it is lemongrass followed by orange, patchouli, frankensence, and somewhat lavender.  Myrrh makes it worse

Flavor is a little lemon forward, in future when lecithin is lowered these can be lowered again.

entry.title: TEEF 3.2 Version Recipe Homemade Teeth Brushing Powder
entry.content:
Added Niacin (helps body fight mouth sores)
Added Riboflavin (Helps body fight mouth sores)
Added Glycine (chelates Iron which causes tooth discoloration)
Arginine 2 was 1.  (Helps fight Dental Plaque)
Proline 30 was 35.  Too much of this causes a liquidy mouthfeel.
40 coconut was 35.  Added to improve essential oil from evaporating making sure foaming was ok with ginseng
95 mint was 93.  boosted for anaerobic which causes deep tooth pain and craze lines.
15 cinnamon was 14.  boosted for anaerobic which causes deep tooth pain and craze lines. lets see if these two work or if lemongrass boost is needed too which seems to help this issue
34 ginseng was 33.  Boosted to counteract more oils.  This will be halved when 60% extract used.
1g sodium citrate was 0.6.  boosted because sodium much higher than potassium in saliva.
potassium gluconate added because potassium promotes blood clotting and gluconate promotes chelation of iron.

entry.title: Organic Teeth Powder Recipe TEEF 3.1 Homemade Professional
entry.content:
Neem 8 was 10.  Lowered to improve aftertaste. 

Coconut 35 was 25.  Raised to help prevent eo evaporation.  Increases h pylori fighting (h pylori causes uncomfortable bottom front teeth and cankers)

MCT 30 was 20.  Raised to help prevent eo evaporation.  Increases h pylori and campylobacter fighting (campy causes slight teeth movement when you push with your tongue).  Capric acid and to a lesser extent caprylic acid both fight campylobacter.

Patchouli 4 was 2.  Patchouli fights campy and since coconut was raised which fights h pylori, h pylori holds campy in check so fighting one you have to fight the other.  Cedarwood, ginger, tagetes also fight campy but they are pretty much at their max amounts without throwing off flavor.

33 ginseng extract was 32.  Boosted to keep foaming constant even with more oil added.

entry.title: TEEF Powder 3.0 Open Source Recipe
entry.content:
As always peel back the ingredients label from the bottom to see what batch number you got.

3.0 replaced all the acidic and alkaline remineralizers OCP, a-TCP, TTCP, and TTCPP with XCP which is a combination of all of them that is also peroxidized for remineralizing and also has a bit of magnesium and silica to mimic natural tooth enamel.

Added Patchouli eo which fights Campylobacter similar to ginger.  Ginger is too strong flavor though to do all the work we need to do against campy.

entry.content:
As always peel back the ingredients label from the bottom to see what batch number you got.  TEEF 3.0 will not start shipping for another couple weeks, currently 2.25 is shipping.

What has changed with 3.0?  Well the remineralizing agents.  In the past I mixed TTCP, OCP, a-TCP and TTCPP to try to achieve an optimum balance that supports healthy enamel.  Well instead of having ingredients that are less alkaline and more alkaline than enamel, why not just make something that mimics enamel exactly?  This is XCP.  Magnesium and Silica are also added to mimic enamel, not just calcium and phosphate.

Full Batch Recipe: Makes 16 70g packs and a 20g pack.  Shipping

Base

740g Tricalcium Phosphate TCP (MySpicer 705082)

Mineralizers

160g Dicalcium Phosphate DCP
 (Eisen-Golden Laboratories EG-CAHPO4-8)
160g XCP (Similar to Hydroxyapatite but better, NatureHacker)

Natural Foaming

32g *ginseng extract (Badmonkey Botanicals 30%)

Amino's and Natural Chelators

35g proline (PureBulk 10912)
4g lysine (PureBulk)
1g histidine (PureBulk)
1g cystiene (PureBulk)
1g arginine (PureBulk)
2g IP6 (Source Naturals SN1366)

Vitamins and Minerals

1g magnesium citrate (NuSci 3344-18-1)
0.6g sodium citrate (Loud Wolf 6132-04-3)
0.2g potassium iodide KI (PureBulk)
0.3g (1cap) zinc citrate (Swanson SW1234)
0.3g (1 cap) selenium (Swanson SWU171)
0.34g (1 cap) thiamin (Natures Way BLK8382)
0.36 (1 cap) biotin (Now Foods 0469B)
0.7g (1 cap) pantothenic acid (Now Foods 0486)
10 drops vitamin D3/K2 (Thorne KD500)

Essential Oils and Carrier Oils

20 *drops black seed oil (Madre Nature)
20 *drops MCT
10 *drops Neem
25 *drops Coconut
93 *drops peppermint eo (Nature'sGift)
23 *drops myrrh eo (Mountain Rose)
22 *drops lavender eo (Mountain Rose)
19 *drops juniper berry eo (Mountain Rose)
18 *drops eucalyptus eo (Mountain Rose)
14 *drops cinnamon eo (Mountain Rose)
14 *drops atlantic cedarwood eo (Stillpoint Aromatics)
13 *drops fresh ginger eo (Mountain Rose)
O13 *drops mastic eo (Nature'sGift)
12 *drops clove eo (Mountain Rose)
10 *drops lemongrass eo (Mountain Rose)
7 *drops red thyme eo (Mountain Rose)
6 *drops orange eo (Mountain Rose)
6 *drops rosemary eo (Mountain Rose)
6 *drops nutmeg eo (Mountain Rose)
6 *drops frankincense eo (Mountain Rose)
5 *drops oregano eo (Mountain Rose)
4 *drops tagetes eo (Stillpoint Aromatocs)
4 *drops carrot eo (Mountain Rose)
3 *drops blue chamomile eo (Mountain Rose)

* = Organic or Wildcrafted or Unsprayed


Use 2 gallon ziploc bag to combine ingredients.

Take 140g of base and all the vitamins and minerals (not mineralizers) and foaming and oils and grind in commercial grinder.  Add this to ziplock with mineralizers and 600g base.  Seal and shake the bag around to finish combining.

entry.title: TEEF Powder 2.24 Open Source Teeth Powder Recipe
entry.content:
As always peel back the ingredients label from the bottom to see what batch number you got.

Thanks to a customer who brought up the issue, TEEF now has higher quality packaging method.  Before no glue was used on the paper and there was some powder leakage.  there still is no glue however there is a natural and organic glue alternative that I use now.  It is just simply starch.  The most natural starch I could find is Organic Green Banana Powder.  Shockingly if you boil a cup of water and stir in a tbsp of green banana powder, you get a glue!  It works very well and there should be no more powder leaking out of the bottom of the bags.  Why green banana?  Because during the process of ripening the starches are converted to sugars, and the starch is what we need to create the natural glue alternative.

25 drops coconut oil was 20 to help more with h pylori (uncomfortable front, especially lower front, teeth)

15 drops neem was 20 lowered for bitterness

93 peppermint was 92 raised for flavor

6 *drops rosemary eo (Mountain Rose)
6 *drops nutmeg eo (Mountain Rose)

5 *drops oregano eo (Mountain Rose)

4 *drops carrot eo (Mountain Rose)
3 *drops blue chamomile eo (Mountain Rose)

---------------------------------

10 lemongrass eo was 12.  Lowered because taste was too fruity and frankincense was added to hopefully help neutralize the bacteria that lemongrass neutralized that caused tooth pain for cracked teeth.  I think thyme also helped that bacteria but too much of thyme causes metallic taste which is countered by lavender likely from clostridum.  If needed lemongrass can be raised to 11 without flavor overpowering but brought to 10 to be safe.

14 cedarwood was 12.  Don't think I have maxed this out in regards to flavor yet, and it is very good against campylobacter so lets try this out.  Need patchouli eo (or jasmine or gardenia) for campy support.  Can't raise ginger any more since flavor concerns.

6 drops frankincense was 0.  Added to help support what lemongrass does but not overpower flavor like raising lemongrass does.  may help campylobacter a tad too.

entry.content:

Essential Oils and Carrier Oils

40 *drops black seed oil (Madre Nature)
85 *drops peppermint eo (Nature'sGift)
23 *drops myrrh eo (Mountain Rose)
22 *drops lavender eo (Mountain Rose)
19 *drops juniper berry eo (Mountain Rose)
17 *drops eucalyptus eo (Mountain Rose)
14 *drops cinnamon eo (Mountain Rose)
13 *drops fresh ginger eo (Mountain Rose)
13 *drops mastic eo (Nature'sGift)
12 *drops atlantic cedarwood eo (Stillpoint Aromatics)
12 *drops lemongrass eo (Mountain Rose)
12 *drops clove eo (Mountain Rose)
8 *drops orange eo (Mountain Rose)
7 *drops red thyme eo (Mountain Rose)
6 *drops rosemary eo (Mountain Rose)
6 *drops nutmeg eo (Mountain Rose)
5 *drops oregano eo (Mountain Rose)
4 *drops tagetes eo (Stillpoint Aromatocs)
4 *drops carrot eo (Mountain Rose)
3 *drops blue chamomile eo (Mountain Rose)

* = Organic or Wildcrafted or Unsprayed

------------------------

22 drops lavender was 20.  Boosted to fight clostridium botulinum.  C botulinum might cause anticholinergic dreams, or dreams could be from gut baccilis cerus whixh boosts acetylcholine and serotonin and causes ectsasy feeling.

17 eucalyptus was 15.  Boosted to corynebacterium diptheriae which causes dmt dreams and infected salivary duct and swollen lymph nodes.

19 drops juniper berry was 18 drops.  Boosted to fight clostridium tetani, tongue twitching hasn't returned but this is to be safe.

12 lemongrass was 11.  Boosted to prevent pain or infection in my cracked tooth.  Be very cautious raising this since taste is strong citrusy.

8 orange was 10.  Lowered to offset taste of increasing lemongrass.

12 clove was 10.  Boosted to fight gram neg like ecoli.  Thyme, oregano, cinnamon, also fight this but those are pretty much at their upper limits due to flavor and also balance verses other oils on bacteria like clostridium in the case of oregano causing metallic taste.

2g ip6 was 3g.  Lowered because chelates calcium along with iron and hard water.

For 12.19 I got lots of good reviews.  Also 2.18 I started to more thouroughly clean out herb grinder I grind the powder and that seems to help flavor too.  Also been lowering bad tasting amino acids like cyctinr and arginine etc.

20 *drops lavender eo (Mountain Rose)
18 *drops juniper berry eo (Mountain Rose)
15 *drops eucalyptus eo (Mountain Rose)
14 *drops cinnamon eo (Mountain Rose)
13 *drops fresh ginger eo (Mountain Rose)
13 *drops mastic eo (Nature'sGift)
12 *drops atlantic cedarwood eo (Stillpoint Aromatics)
11 *drops lemongrass eo (Mountain Rose)
10 *drops orange eo (Mountain Rose)
10 *drops clove eo (Mountain Rose)
7 *drops red thyme eo (Mountain Rose)
6 *drops rosemary eo (Mountain Rose)
6 *drops nutmeg eo (Mountain Rose)
5 *drops oregano eo (Mountain Rose)
4 *drops tagetes eo (Stillpoint Aromatocs)
4 *drops carrot eo (Mountain Rose)
3 *drops blue chamomile eo (Mountain Rose)

* = Organic or Wildcrafted or Unsprayed

------------------------

Order myrrh cinnamon ginger cham juniper

Need to fight diptheria bacteria that can live in salivary duct and cause dmt dreams.  Eucalyptus should work also turmeric, sandlewood, patchouli also should work.

1g histidine was 2.  Lowered for taste.  In recipie for enamel support and chelator.

1g cystiene was 2.  Lowered for taste.  In recipie for enamel support and chelator.

1g arginine was 2.  Lowered for taste.  In recipe for enamel support and chelation.

3g IP6 was 4g.  Lowered to reduce chelation since chelation can also grab calcium and reduce remineralization.  In recipie to help bind up iron in the mouth, which iron promotes bacterial growth.

15 eucalyptus was 12. see above.

11 lemongrass was 12.  Lowered to reduce citrusy flavor.  Lemongrass counters fubgus like aspergillis and also h pylori.  Also helps tooth pain.

10 orange was 15.  Lowered to reduce citrusy flavor.  Orange fights klebsellia, serratia, and h pylori.

85 peppermint was 80.  Increased to improce flavor.  Peppernint fights anaerobic bacteria that cause teeth sensitivity and also tooth pain.

23 myrrh was 20.  Increased to compensate for loss of lemongrass and orange in regard to h pylori.

If flavor is still citrusy/odd look at cedarwood which was increased last batch.

Well flavor is a bit odd but not citrusy mabye on the opposite side herbal or something.  Vould be cedarwood or myrrh im thinking.  Or eucalyptus.  Not much have I added and I think the flavor is one I didn't notice before so it seems new.

0g monolaurin was 2g.  Lowered to prevent off flavor and also demineralization from the glycerine molecule present.  Monolaurin improves h pylori fighting, may want to revisit adding 1g in the future.

Monolaurin gave a little off taste.  Lemongrass flavor forward in eo mix so need to lower that a bit which it helps with h pylori, so does monolaurin.

Full Batch Recipe: Makes ~16 packs

Base

740g Tricalcium Phosphate TCP (MySpicer 705082)

Mineralizers

 (Eisen-Golden Laboratories EG-CAHPO4-8)

------------------------

4 drops tagetes was 6.  Lowered because overpowered flavor with sour orange.  Tagetes targets campylobacter and sore throat so lets hope that cedarwood compensates.  Also monocaprin would help campy.

10 drops cedarwood was 7.  Boosted to help kill campylobacter, since lowered tagetes, which causes slight tooth movement.  Hopefully won't mess up the flavor.

20 drops lavender was 19.  Boosted to help lower metallic taste in the mouth.

18 drops juniper berry eo was 17.  Boosted to kill clostridium tetani which causes tongue twitching.  Seems to be enough to counter it fully.

4g IP6 was 3.2.  Boosted to help with metallic taste in the mouth which is also helped by lavender.

2g monolaurin was 0.  Added to help kill h pylori and support foaming.  Monocaprin kills campylobacter so we need that too but it is not commercially available so I will have to make it.

entry.title: I will now start putting Revision # on packages!
entry.content:
So there will now be a secret way to determine what batch # you recieved apart from trying to match up the dates and whatnot.  This will especially be good for purchases from amazon where they have a mix of batches from different time periods.

Underneath the bottom of the ingredients label will be a handwritten revision number like "2.17".  So on future batches you will be able to peel up the ingredients label from the bottom and you should see a number written in sharpie.  This will better help you know what the exact recipe of that batch was by visiting teefpowder.com.  Also that will help you to provide me feedback of what you like when you email teefpowder2.0 a t gmail.

entry.title: Teef Teeth Powder 2.16: Open Source Full Recipe Homemade
entry.content:
This batch tastes a little orangy, which will be fixed in 2.17, it is from increased tagetes essential oil.  Shipped 12 packs to amazon oct 1st and any orders on this website made on or after october 2nd is 2.16.  Monolaurin coming in 2.17!  I'm excited.

Thanks to a convo with a very astute customer (who really liked revision 2.5!) it has woken me up to some aspects of the current revision that may not be optimal.  Usually when designing you want to find that sweet spot with every ingredient where it is just enough but not too much.  Sometimes I will overshoot something to experiment and forget to tune it back.  Complaints were that the new revision is less scrubbing than 2.5 (which is because OCP feels lighter, mastic gum, and higher proline, and different foaming agent) and tastes like spoiled orange.  This may be from the combination of high citrus eo's and also some vitamins, aminos, and selenium added which can have a sulfur flavor.  Also complained that it is more watery during use.  I think this is a combination of too high proline, different foaming agent, and higher oil percentage.  Also in the future I will add hyaluronic acid (edit: can't add it because it kills all the foam) which should further thicken. Customer also noted burning gums which may either be an essential oil or the mastic gum (I noted allergy to mastic gum when it was at 10g).
I am very grateful to this customer as they have gotten me to reconsider many things that may not be optimal in the current revision!  Email teefpowder2.0 at gmail to give me your input as well.

Full Batch Recipe: Makes ~15 packs

Base

740g Tricalcium Phosphate TCP (MySpicer 705082)

Mineralizers

160g Dicalcium Phosphate DCP
 (Eisen-Golden Laboratories EG-CAHPO4-8)
60g Tetracalcium Phosphate Peroxide TTCPP (NatureHacker)
40g Tetracalcium Phosphate TTCP (NatureHacker)
40g Octacalcium Phosphate OCP (NatureHacker)
20g alpha-Tricalcium Phosphate aTCP (NatureHacker)

Natural Foaming

75g ginseng extract (NuSci 30786)

Amino's and Natural Chelators

45g proline (PureBulk 10912)
4g lysine (PureBulk)
2g histidine (PureBulk)
2g cystiene (PureBulk)
2g arginine (PureBulk)
3.2g (4 caps) IP6 (Jarrow Formulas 120011)

Vitamins and Minerals

1g magnesium citrate (NuSci 3344-18-1)
0.6g sodium citrate (Loud Wolf 6132-04-3)
0.2g potassium iodide KI (PureBulk)
0.3g (1cap) zinc citrate (Swanson SW1234)
0.3g (1 cap) selenium (Swanson SWU171)
0.34g (1 cap) thiamin (Natures Way BLK8382)
0.36 (1 cap) biotin (Now Foods 0469B)
0.7g (1 cap) pantothenic acid (Now Foods 0486)
10 drops vitamin D3/K2 (Thorne KD500)

Essential Oils, Carrier Oils, and Gums

40 drops black seed oil (Artizen Oils)
80 *drops peppermint eo (Nature'sGift)
20 *drops myrrh eo (Mountain Rose)
19 *drops lavender eo (Mountain Rose)
17 *drops juniper berry oil (Mountain Rose)
15 *drops orange eo (Mountain Rose)
15 *drops lemongrass eo (Mountain Rose)
14 *drops cinnamon eo (Mountain Rose)
13 *drops fresh ginger eo (Mountain Rose)
13 *drops mastic eo (Nature'sGift)
12 *drops eucalyptus eo (Mountain Rose)
10 *drops clove eo (Mountain Rose)
7 *drops red thyme eo (Mountain Rose)
7 *drops cedarwood eo (Stillpoint Aromatics)
6 *drops rosemary eo (Mountain Rose)
6 *drops nutmeg eo (Mountain Rose)
6 *drops tagetes eo (Stillpoint Aromatocs)
5 *drops oregano eo (Mountain Rose)
4 *drops carrot eo (Mountain Rose)
3 *drops blue chamomile eo (Mountain Rose)

* = Organic or Wildcrafted or Unsprayed

------------------------

45g Proline was 50g.  Reverting because customer made me aware that formula was more watery seeming.  In future will try hyaluronic acid which may help thickness.

0g Mastic Gum was 3g.  Reverting because customer noticing gum burning sensation which may be allergy to mastic.  Also I am testing to see if this ingredient is helpful at all because when this was at 10g I was allergic so may be an unecessary potential allergen. May end up settling on 1-1.5g since it does seem to polish teeth a bit.  May try myrrh gum as well or instead.

15 orange eo was 17.  Lowering because of complaints of too citrusy flavor and I don't feel it needs to be this high.

13 drops mastic eo was 12.  Raised because of removal of mastic gum.

19 drops lavender eo was 18, added to continue fighting metallic taste in mouth.

7 cedarwood was 6.  Boosted to help campylobacter which causes slight teeth movement when pushing with tongue.  Also helps combat metallic taste in mouth.

6 tagetes was 5.  Boosted for same reason as cedarwood in terms of campylobacter and and also chronic sore throat.

Tried .05g hyaluronic acid in 20g teef powder and it killed any foam produced.  Perhaps for use in toof paste but can't see it working in any appreciable amount in teef powder.

Tagetes may be sour orange smell

link.title: Teef Teeth Powder 2.16: Open Source Full Recipe Homemade

75g ginseng was 80.  Lowered to reduce bitterness.

Major taste improvement! Today I iterated the essential oil blend about 5 times before arriving at the current essential oil blend for 2.11.  It now tastes like sweet bright mint with a touch of cinnamon.  This recipie is a touch bitter from the ginseng extract which will be lowered to 80g in 2.12 so hopefully we can minimize the bitter taste.

Needs tagetes (10 drops) and cedarwood (5 drops) for campylobacter which creates loose teeth.  Ginger kills campylobacter but I can't add enough without overpowering the taste.

May be too low in oregano and thyme or lemongrass to keep my cracked tooth uninfected and painless but too much oregano and thyme gave me a metalic taste in the mouth which I wanted to counter with lavender (metallic taste caused by clostridium botulinum).  Also a big part of this rework is to make teef taste better so mint and cinnamon forward.  Thought peppermint was the biggest fixer of cracked tooth pain but mabye not.  Upped lemongrass from 8 to 13 and seems better now.

14 drops lavender was 6.  Added to combat metallic taste in mouth caused by clostridium botulinm  and future may include garlic and cedarwood to help this.  Cedarwood also helps fight campylobacter.

8 drops carrot eo was 22.  I think this eo is the culprit for a kind of unsavory taste.  Carrot kills hpylori but so does mastic and myrrh and uncomfortable lower front teeth so chances are we are fine on our hpylori killing power.

70 drops peppermint eo was 65.  Boosted because customer started getting teeth sensitivity which is caused by anaerobic bacteria which bacteria is killed by peppermint.

12 drops mastic was 7.  This was originally lowered because it made things too herbal tasting but that was likely the high mastic gum not the actual essential oil.  Fights h pylori uncomfortable front lower teeth and cankers.

16 drops myrrh was 10.  Excellent against h pylori and cankers.

13 drops juniper berry was 12.  Juniper berry fights clostridium tetani which causes twitching tongue.  Lavender may also fight this.

5 drops blue chamomile was 10.

4 drops thyme was 24.  Lowered because caused metallic taste in the mouth

4 drops oregano was 16.  Same as thyme.

13 drops lemongrass was 16.  Was a little too bright tasting.  I tried even lower but lemongrass is needed to prevent infection of cracked teeth.

13 drops ginger was 14.  Was a little too sharp tasting and campylobacter will get more help from tagetes and cedarwood oil in 2.12.

14 drops cinnamon oil was 22.  Lowered because too much cinnamon flavor and I don't really think itnis necessary that high for any oral conditions I know about.

20 drops orange was 35.  Made it a little too bright tasting.  It was boosted for h pylori help but with myrrh and mastic we are fine with that.

Mastic kills h pylori along with myrrh and carrot.  Raised since carrot bieng lowered.  Also h pylori causes canker sores along with clostridium perferingins.  Lavender boosted to kill c. Perferingins which causes canker sores.  Juniper berry boosted because kills clostridium difficile which causes sore throat.  Ginger boosted because it kills campylobacter which bacteria causes slight tooth loosening.  Campylobacter and h pylori are enemies and killing one too much causes an overgrowth in the other.  Blue chamomile lowered because the bitter taste and not good at killing h pylori which it was added to kill.

Campylobacter marigold (tagetes) ginger jasmine
Also ecoli listeria etc.
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/12380738

more neutral was a tiny alkaline in 2.9.

May boost in future.  Cankers are likely caused by clostridium perferingens and cured with lavender.  The way this works is h pylori drills into the oral mucosa and clostridium perferingins causes the bubble which erupts.  Carrot seed essential oil and lavender essential oil is needed to reverse cankers.

12 drops juniper berry eo was 10.  Added to combat sore throat likely caused by clostridium spp.

All essential oils are now organic!  The ginseng and gynostemma extract aren't organic but it is impossible to get organically and is better than any soap or surfactant based foaming.  I consider TEEF organic now but it is up to you to decide for yourself.

Future may add cardamon for bacillis inclusing anthrax which might (not sure at all at this point) cause clottyness when brushing.

Grind mastic gum with 100g of TCP powder.  Then add another 100g TCP powder and all the ingredients except the mineralizer powders.  Add essential oils.  Grind again.  Add this to 2 gallon ziploc and add the mineralizers and mix by hand.

140g DCP was 37g, boosted because was way too high pH since I got fresher CaOH to produce Tetracalcium Phosphate.

7 drops mastic was 10 drops.  Very overpowering at 10 drops but that may have been the high amount of mastic gum too.

3g mastic gum was 10g.  10g was too much and caused me some itchiness when using a lot of powder.

Including myrrh and juniper berry eo for the first time, forgot to actually add them in 2.8.  Myrrh is for h pylori (uncomfortable lower front teeth) and juniper berry is for tetanus (causes tongue and eye twitching) and also chronic sore throat.

3g gynostemma extract was 8g.  Tone down bitterness a bit.

770g TCP was 810.  Lowered to make room for increased DCP.

0.1g KI was 0.  Added for some antimicrobial Iodine.  Each bag only contains 7mg so even if the whole bag was eaten it would still be safe.

Tetracalcium phosphosilicate
ACP

entry.title: Worldwide Free Shipping!
entry.content:
Try the Best Tooth Powders Free with Free Shipping!

So this may be a hair premature, and it is possible (5% chance) we will need to re-implement international shipping charges, but based on current data we can actually make it work.

How can we ship a $12.75 product for free worldwide with a tracking number?  Well for one because we can ship internationally differently that domestically.  Domestic shipping requires a "package" in order to get a tracking number.  However a "flat" gets a tracking number when shipped internationally.  So that means that the method of international shipping is inherently cheaper, albiet a little higher cost just for the distance it travels.

So we will make a little less on international orders than domestic.  But that is something we can absorb.  Why?  Because making money is not the primary goal of TEEF.  The goal is to inspire and empower and we believe that free international shipping will go a long way to inspire our global customers.  People who do not live in the US may feel like they are living in a shadow and are second class citizens.  Offering free shipping to these customers we hope will be taken as a gesture that we believe we are all equal and are all one no matter what "country" we happened to be born in.  Every one of us is absolutely essential in making this world a better place.

entry.title: Teef Powder 2.7 all natural teeth powder open source recipe
entry.content:
Try Latest Natural TEEF Free!

 This recipe shipped since 7/22/2019

Paper in 2.7 was changed to LCI papers 80lb no bleach no dye 11"x17" cut to 11x13 for cover and 9 5/8"x14" for inner holder.  Folded back 5cm.  See video: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=jxG7z8jaAhU


2x Batch Recipe:

908g Tricalcium Phosphate TCP (MySpicer 705082)

6 drops nutmeg eo (Now Foods)

4g Mastic Gum extract was 0.  Added for h pylori, essential oils don't seem to cut it.  (Especially because the eo's that treat it carrot and lemongrass have very strong taste so can't be elevated much) H pylori causes uncomfortable bottom front teeth.

2g histidine was 0g.  Added because histidine and proline are in saliva.  Also works as a chelator

1.6g IP6 was 0g.  Added because IP6 is an all natural chelator.  This can help remove oral iron which causes bacterial growth and also may help foam production.

10g gynostemma was 6g.  Added a bit of this back since the bitterness will help offset the sweetness of the ginseng, also helps improve foaming.

80g ginseng extract was 70.  Improves foaming.

40 drops black seed was 30.  More carrier oil added since saponins increased which will still allow for foaming.

22 drops carrot was 20.  Need more help with h pylori (cause uncomfortable/itchy bottom front teeth)

22 drops cinnamon was 20.  Need more help with anaerobics (cause teeth that feel like are pressurized)

30 drops orange eo was 8.  This was low because the limonene present dissolves plastic.  Now that it is packaged in paper there is no concern.  Helps with h pylori and also serratia.  H pylori causes uncomfortable or itchy bottom front teeth along with cankers.  Myrrh (and later mastic gum) will be added in next batch which will also help with h pylori.

12 drops ginger eo was 8. Ginger kills campylobacter which causes slight teeth loosening but killing it causes h pylori overgrowth.  Now that we have more support against h pylori with the orange, we should be able to boost ginger without issues.

60 drops peppermint was 52.  Peppermint gyards against tooth pressure (craze lines and pain) and teeth sensitivity.  Added to balance extra orange oil.

10 drops VitD/K2 was 3 drops.  Raised just on a hunch that it would be better.

Thiamin, Biotin, Pantothenic acid tweaked to be 1 capsule per batch.


Future possibly glycine, potassium iodide, mustard eo, myrrh eo, mastic gum

Carnosine and glutamine for h pylori
http://www.positivehealth.com/article/nutrition/nutritional-care-of-peptic-ulcer

Seems like campylobacter causes teeth loosening, ginger eo cures it.  Need to try carrot to make sure h pylori isn't involved.  Ginger also causes uncomfortable itchy feeling so that means that is caused by h pylori for sure.  Uncomfortable front teeth cured with lemongrass eo.

https://ceramics.org/ceramic-tech-today/biomater

Silica teeth sockets campylobacter?
https://thegrownetwork.com/equisetum-hyemale-horsetail/

Campylobacter most common diahrrea illness
https://www.cdc.gov/healthywater/drinking/private/wells/disease/campylobacter.html

Campy #1 diahrrea, horsetail diahrrea so silica campy?
https://selfhacked.com/blog/horsetail/

Silica diarrhea
https://www.healthyhubb.com/health-benefits-silica/

Horsetail uti
https://www.richters.com/show.cgi?page=QandA/Medicinal/20010513-1.html

Horsetail ecoli
https://selfhacked.com/blog/bulbine-natalensis/

Got purer caoh and tcp for making ttcp.  Melt is very dark, must be calcium nitride formung.  Hoping h2o2 whitens it as ca3n2 reacts with h2o to make ammonia and calcium hydroxude. Also I expect silicon dioxide to protect from nitrogen when I start making tetracalcium phosphosilicate.  Also in future need vacuum inert atmosphere furnace to get pure product. Or pure oxygen atmosphere?

So the old stuff probably had some carbonates which were carbide formers which prevented some nitride formation.  This was probably why it was harder to grind a bit than the new version.  Wrong, CaOH was just weak.  Melting TCP was pure white.  This may also make ACP by melting TCP and cooling quickly...

Silicon dioxide was added and it made the pH relatively low so more calcium hydroxide needs to be added to balance.

Need inert gas tank to blow over during welding to prevent nitride formation.  Unless we peroxidize first before torching...  Peroxide doesn't work.  Need to try argon.

Carbonate doesn't effect the nitriding either.  Looks like the reason the old stuff was a lighter color is the calcium hydroxide was probably weak.

Flams spray synthesis of ACP
https://www.scientific.net/KEM.396-398.595

entry.title: TEEF Powder 2.6! Open Source teeth tooth toothpowder teethpowder
entry.content:
Try Latest Organic TEEF Free!

The biggest change you will notice with 2.6 is the packaging.  Huge upgrade and this is only the beginning!  We are also starting a plastic free version (use coupon code NOPLASTIC for 5% off and get a plastic free version, including packaging). The standard version will be minimal plastic but each TEEF pack will be vacuum sealed in a plastic bag for virtually unlimited storage.  Don't tear the paper that TEEF is in!  This is the container, simply pull the two halves apart vertically.  It is in an oragami paper bag.

Full Batch Recipe:

454g Tricalcium Phosphate TCP (MySpicer 705082)
30g  Tetracalcium Phosphate Peroxide TTCPP (NatureHacker)
20g Tetracalcium Phosphate TTCP (NatureHacker)
35g  ginseng extract (NuSci 30786)
3g gynostemma extract powder (98% Lesen)
18.5g Dicalcium phosphate DCP (Eisen-Golden Laboratories EG-CAHPO4-8)
15g proline (PureBulk 10912)
2g lysine (PureBulk)
0.5g magnesium citrate (NuSci 3344-18-1)
0.3g sodium citrate (Loud Wolf 6132-04-3)
0.2g zinc citrate (Swanson SW1234)
0.15g selenium (Swanson SWU171)
0.15g thiamin (Natures Way BLK8382)
0.15g biotin (now foods 0469B)
0.15g pantothenic acid (now foods 0486)
3 drops vitamin D3/K2 (thorne KD500)
15 drops black seed oil (Artizen Oils)
26 drops peppermint Essential Oil (eo)(Now Foods)
12 drops thyme eo (Now Foods)
10 drops carrot eo (Now Foods)
10 drops cinnamon eo (Now Foods)
8 drops lemongrass eo (Now Foods)
8 drops oregano eo (Now Foods)
5 drops blue chamomile eo (Mountain Rose)
5 drops eucalyptus eo (Now Foods)
5 drops clove eo (Now Foods)
4 drops fresh ginger eo (Mountain Rose)
3 drops orange eo (Now Foods)
3 drops rosemary eo (Now Foods)
3 drops nutmeg eo (Now Foods)

Do not add TTCPP to the grinder. grind in 2kg herb grinder but add only 200 TCP max to grinder.  If grinder needs oil use black seed to lubricate.

Added ginseng
3 gynostemma was 15
26 mint was 25
12 thyme was 14
10 cinnamon was 9
10 carrot was 12
4 ginger was 5
8 lemongrass was 3
added sodium citrate
added magnesium citrate
added zinc citrate
added SeMSC
added Thiamin
added Lysine
added black seed oil

This is beyond Open Source now.  Not only am I giving you all the ingredients and exact recipie, but also my sources!  There is nothing holding you back from making and selling this tomarrow.  This is beyond Capitalism, its Givism.

We needed even more help with h pylori (causes uncomfortable bottom front teeth)and carrot was too high since it adds a weird flavor.  Lemongrass kill h pylori so we boosted that.  Black seed oil kills h pylori also it is a carrier oil hopefully will slow essential oil evaporation from the formula, may need a bit of coconut oil in the future? Also ginger kills campylobacter, and campy and hpylori kind of balance each other so I lowered ginger a touch.  I had some ginseng extract and tested against the gynostemma I always use and lo and behold the ginseng seems better! Bigger bubbles and much less bitter so we swapped that in and boosted for even better foam.  Ginseng extract is a bit sweet so kept a little gynostemma to balance a little bitterness with the sweetness.  Boosted mint for anaerobics (cause teeth that feel like under pressure) and cinnamon for h pylori.  Lowered thyme since we're not having issues with gram neg (metallic taste in mouth or bad breath). Magnesium and sodium and zinc citrate added since not only magnesium and zinc and sodium are a part of healthy enamel and bone, and zinc prevents over remineralization, but also because citrate is a very important part of enamel as well.  Thiamin (B1) and selenium were also added because they are known to be important for remineralization and antioxidants and immunity.  In the future I anticipate less adding ingrediebts and more tuning levels, right now I am doing lots of work on it since the Amazon launch is coming soon and I want everything to be near finalized. Some other eos for hpylori are savory, manuka, vervein, cinnamon.

Lysine added for collagen production also h pylori

Still getting some teeth loosening, hpy or campy?

h pylori causes uncomfortable bottom front teeth need to boost h pylori oils

anaerobics cause pain internal to teeth and craze lines.  boost mint if so.

Consider uv bleaching TTCPP since it has a Tan color after peroxidation.  UV may remove peroxide though?  Mabye keeping temp low during peroxidation could help?

entry.title: Every Customer is Valuable
entry.content:
Try Latest TEEF Free!

At TEEF we don't believe in consumers.  We believe in customers.  Every person that we please, we strongly believe, will be our Advocate's.  Every person we help will be a beacon of hope for their friends.  We know that if we produce true value for people that it will be returned to us as wind in our sails ten times over.

It is a simple philosophy but one we know has been proven time and again, immemorial.

Concrete steps we are taking to embody this philosophy is as follows and more to come:

1.  Listen to your feedback with an open mind and collaborate with you on how things can be improved.  Try to open dialog with you on your platform of choice so we know what is important to you.

2. Strive to continuously improve the product and methods.  Our founder is also our lead Researcher and Designer; fully commited to this product taking continuous steps towards perfection.

3. Give back in terms of converting profit efficiency gain from economy of scale into reinvesting into improving the product and/or lowering the price as much as possible.  We believe in charity, but we are not going to spend your money on fulfilling our charitable goals.  Our job is to keep the price as low as possible so you can decide how best you should use your extra money.  We believe in you, we know that your ideas for your money are better than our ideas for your money.  So we won't take more of your money than necessary.  This will inform our growth strategies.

4. A pledge to never sell out.  We will not sell our buisness or our recipies to anyone or anything.  We firmly believe in your right to know every ingredient we include and the amount and that every product of ours will be fully open source from conception and forever after.  We encourage everyone to make and give away and/or sell products that use or build on our designs and recipies.

5.  Strive for the highest quality ingredients.  We are very discerning in the ingredients we use.  We use this product too and make sure we are confident of all our ingredients source and quality.  We will continue this and take it farther to strive for every ingredient sourced from the highest quality suppliers and cleanest methods such as organic, as possible.  Also we will provide you with the supplier name that we currently use for every ingredient we use.

6.  Every order will ship fast and have a tracking number.  Barring unforseen circumstances, from now on every order will be shipped quickly and have a tracking number.  We are doing this because we will start selling on amazon and we are extending the same shipping improvements on website orders as well.

7.  If we notice something wrong we will let you know on the blog as a minimum.  If we notice something may not be right about a batch we will make a blog post about it and we are including procedure to contact everyone that recieved the affected batch so they know what to expect.  Of course we hope that nothing will ever go wrong, but in case it does, we are commited to transparency and making it right.

8.  We will not delay in doing any good thing.  If it is in our power to act for good, we will do it without delay.  For example if we know a certain ingredient would improve the recipie but costs more, we will make the change in the very next batch.

In conclusion, we are commited to make every buisness decision with our customers as the #1 factor in our decisions.  We will always ensure that what is best for the customer is what will be done.  And this will not be done at the expense of our suppliers or our partners (we will never have employees) or anyone else.  Everyone is our customer and we realize that.

entry.title: Packaging and price change coming in August
entry.content:
Try Natural Teeth Powder Free with Free Shipping!

We at TEEF want to make a product that we ourselves would buy and think it is a good deal.  That is our goal, to add as much value as we can while keeping prices as low as possible.  I think you will love our future packaging.  Not only will it be a work of art on your countertop and have amazing functionality and make you feel proud to give it as a gift, but also it will store basically forever.  Stack 100 in your emergency stash and in 20 years they will likely still be fresh.

The new packaging will cost us well upwards of $1-2 for each 70g pack of TEEF.  However we are going to eat half of that cost ourselves and only raise prices by $0.75 since we are so excited about the new functionality.  So the new price will be raised to $12.75 here instead of $12.00 and shipping to the US is of course still free.  Also we are going to launch on amazon the same exact product for $17 (edit now $14). The raise in price for the Amazon purchase is because the high seller fees on amazon and the price for sponsorship which we will launch.

So I'm excited and lets hope this launches TEEF into the mainstream, and global oral health improves drastically! Got those dentists shivering in their boots!  Nah, I'm sure Dentists love us for making their job easier!

entry.title: TEEF 2.5 Teeth Powder Recipe
entry.content:
Try Latest TEEF Free!

Get ready to fly because in TEEF 2.5 we are going stratospheric!

Our signature ingredient Tetracalcium phosphate peroxide has been boosted to unheard of levels, ~10% of the recipie.  Why? Because we can!  We hold nothing back!

"Unneccesary" powder plant extracts are now removed and we are going to entirely rely on essential oils for microbe killing action.  The training wheels are off!  Bear with me as I begin to tweak the essential oil blend to accomodate this big change while maintaining the perfect balance of the oral microbiota.  The removed extracts include dark brown tribulus extract (was used as supplementary foaming agent, replaced with boost of white gynostemma extract), ginger extract (was used to fight campylobacter, replaced with ginger essential oil, future may get gingerol if we need more help against this bacteria ), wheatgrass juice powder (used to kill h pylori, replaced with boost of blue chamomile and carrot), and garlic extract (replaced with eucalyptus).

Patch Notes:

5 eucalyptus was 0
3 rosemary was 2
3 lemongrass was 2
25 peppermint was 23
9 carrot was 8
5 blue chamomile was 3
5 ginger was 3
3 vitamin d3/k2 was 2
0.15g biotin/pantothenic acid was 0.10g
50g TTCPP was 27g
18.5g DCP was 10g
15g Gynostemma extract was 12g
removed ginger extract
removed wheatgrass juice powder
removed tribulus extract
removed garlic extract

So it should taste fresher and a bit less bitter, and will hopefully be even better at keeping teeth unstained.  The astronomical boost to TTCPP should boost teeth enamel the likes of which has never been imagined by the human mind. The removed extracts were added to the recipe before I mastered the science of the essential oil, so in light of the continuous advancements in TEEF essential oils, I think we can now forgo them.

Full Batch Recipe:

454g Tricalcium Phosphate TCP
50g Tetracalcium Phosphate Peroxide TTCPP
18.5g Dicalcium phosphate DCP
15g  proline
15g  gynostema extract
0.15g biotin (now foods 0469B)
0.15g pantothenic acid (now foods 0486)
3 drops vitamin D3/K2 (thorne KD500)
25 drops peppermint eo
14 drops thyme eo
9 drops cinnamon Essential Oil (eo)
9 drops carrot eo
8 drops oregano eo
5 drops blue chamomile eo
5 drops fresh ginger eo
5 drops eucalyptus eo
5 drops clove eo
3 drops orange eo
3 drops lemongrass eo
3 drops rosemary eo
3 drops nutmeg eo

grind in 2kg herb grinder but add only 254 TCP max to grinder.

entry.title: TEEF 2.4
entry.content:
Try Organic TEEF Powder Free with Free Shipping!

In 2.4 we made some minor but potentially powerful tweaks.  Based on my ongoing research there are several vitamins (not just minerals) that can also support healthy enamel repair osteoblast activity including vitamin D and K2.  Vitamin A hurts remineralization so avoid overdosing that.  Also from a protien creation perspective (teeth contain collagen and some keratin) biotin and pantothenic acid may also help.  We know of those from hair health, and teeth are somewhat related in my view. Anyway I think those two will help as well.  Next we add some essential oils namely fresh ginger and German chamomile (both from mountain rose, rest of the eos are NOW brand).  Ginger essential oil is one of the best against campylobacter and German chamomile is one of the best against h pylori; two of the most important bacteria in oral health, from what I remember they are involved with loosening of teeth and canker sores.  Also the foaming herbs gynostemma and tribulus terrestris extracts slightly increased.

454g TCP food grade (add only 254 max to grinder)
27g TTCPP (tetra calcium phosphate peroxide)
10g Dicalcium phosphate
15g  proline
0.1g biotin (now foods 0469B)
0.1g pantothenic acid (now foods 0486)
12g  gynostema extract
2.5g  tribulus extract
4g Ginger extract
4g Wheatgrass juice powder
3g Garlic extract
2 drops vitamin D3/K2 (thorne KD500)
9 drops cinnamon Essential Oil (eo)
3 drops orange eo
2 drops lemongrass eo
2 drops rosemary eo
5 drops clove eo
3 drops nutmeg eo
23 drops peppermint eo
14 drops thyme eo
8 drops oregano eo
8 drops carrot eo
3 drops blue chamomile eo
3 drops ginger eo

grind in 2kg herb grinder.

entry.title: Higher quality mixing of TEEF
entry.content:
Natural Teeth Powder Free with Free Shipping!


Starting with the batch that just shipped out this week, we are using a new blending method.  I have noticed some uneven mixing of essential oils and herbal extract powders in the past with hand mixing the ingredients by shaking and mixing the product around in Ziploc bags.  We just recently acquired a professional herb grinder and are now using that to blend the TEEF Powder.  I have noticed truly zero clumps since making this switch.  I think you will notice a much higher quality product!

entry.title: How to Use
entry.content:
Try Organic TEEF Powder Free!




Recently, we have gotten questions on how to use TEEF Powder 2.0 as well as concerns that come up after using it for some time. As a substitute to fluoride rich toothpaste and products, use TEEF Powder 2.0 just as you would those. The key to quality oral health is to remain consistent. The most important bit of information would be to KEEP FLOSSING. If your teeth become too tight or too tight to begin with, make sure you use those "flossers" available at most stores. Also, you can get a oral care kit to remove plaque or build up from the gum line or between teeth.

Examples of "flossers":



If in doubt, visit your local dentist.

entry.title: Features
entry.content:
TEEF Powder is designed with a few factors in mind.

Safety:  Only All-Natural and Organic plant and mineral based ingredients are used.
  1. Ginseng extract is used instead of chemical surfactants or even saponified oils.
  2. Amino Acids are used as chelators to combat hard water and improve mouthfeel and mineralization.
  3. Proven remineralizing Hydroxyapatite emulsion is used instead of fluoride or baking soda to strengthen enamel.
  4. Detoxifying essential oils instead of triclosan or stannous chloride (tin) or Silver (Which is a Heavy Metal).
  5. Fully non-abrasive (unlike baking soda) and aluminum-free (unlike bentonite clay)
Oral Detox:
  1. Broad spectrum essential oil blend will reset your oral environment into great health
  2. Essential oil blend designed to detoxify problems from all possible pathogenic bacteria 
  3. Organic essential oils used
  4. Coconut and black seed oil used 
Remineralization Promotion:
  1.  Osteoblast activity supported by soluble vitamins and minerals including D, K2, B vitamins
  2.  Proline and other amino acids that promote collagen support in teeth.
  3.  Hydroxiapatite proven remineralizer emulsion.
Pleasant Taste:
  1. No added sweeteners or artificial or even natural flavors.  
  2. Ginseng extract has low bitterness
  3. Essential oils provide a fresh flavor.

entry.title: About Us
entry.content:
TEEF powder wasn't designed, it is bieng designed every day by a man who goes by NatureHacker.

NatureHacker may not show off 12 letters after his name like some others but rather would have you judge him based on his work.  He believes that if you study his recipe you will gain an appreciation for not only his scientific and design expertise but also his faith in nature.

NatureHacker started designing TEEF out of necessity.  He is an idealist and didn't like using SLS/Fluoride based toothpastes and had an eye opening experience by damaging his enamel with a seemingly harmless natural alternative, baking soda.  Not only did it erode his enamel by seemingly wearing it away like an abrasive, it made his teeth so unnaturally hard that one with an old filling actually shattered. 

He started researching teeth enamel.  With his background in chemistry and biology he learned that baking soda creates a false enamel called carboxyapatite.  He learned that fluoride creates a false enamel fluorapatite.  Hydroxyapatite is the real enamel and this -OH molecule sent him on a quest that took years of research, experimentation, and discovery and finally lead to the breakthrough ingredient Tetracalcium Phosphate.  Again with his background in chemistry and biology he realized that peroxidizing it would make it even more "sticky" to enamel as this is what naturally happens in saliva.

The formula is never complete and keeps getting better over time.  TEEF started in 2014 as simply Baking powder (since it contained calcium phosphates) and calcium hydroxide (for the -OH) which turned out to be way too alkaline and hurt gums, to the extremely mature and gentle product it is today.  5 years of constant research and experimentation have brought us to the literally "out of this world" technology in TEEF.  This formula will obsolete fluoride for good.  Oh and that shattered tooth? It's as good as new again. 

The reason TEEF is so effective is as a professional designer, NatureHacker never arrives.  He is constantly questioning his own premises, carefully observing, experimenting, pouring over actual scientific research - not just parroting hearsay like all the wannabe bloggers, and recording and publishing what he finds.  He honestly cares about humanity and tries his best to teach everything he learns - including the full recipes and ingredient sources for every product.  Who knows, perhaps your interactions with him will influence the future of TEEF, many already have.  And more importantly, perhaps TEEF can inspire and empower you along your own path as well.  Let's talk: teefpowder2.0 at gmail.

entry.title: How To Use
entry.content:
Recently, we have gotten questions on how to use TEEF Powder. As a substitute to fluoride rich toothpaste and products, use TEEF Powder just as you would those.

Slide the Paper Halves apart vertically, do not try to unwrap the paper bag!

Moisten brush, shake off excess water, tap powder out onto toothbrush or dip into powder, and brush.  Double dip, and brush some more (your significant other can get their own pack!)  I love the Bigelow Toothbrushes with natural bristles and Bambun Silk Floss from Amazon!

The key to quality oral health is to remain consistent. The most important bit of information would be to brush twice a day and KEEP FLOSSING.





Also, you can get a oral care kit to remove plaque or build up from the gum line or between teeth.


If in doubt, visit your local dentist.

It is good that there no big gaps in between teeth that food particles get caught, but not being able to floss in between is too much most likely.

https://earthclinic.com/supplements/mms/ . Wow! taking Pro-biotics are suggested now too. So what people are saying about MSM is changing radically.

I am going to use TEEF II and maybe iodine from now on to fight mouth bacteria.

entry.title:
NatureHacker,
Im looking forward to my next shi...
entry.content:
NatureHacker,

Im looking forward to my next shipment of Teef Powder! Thank you for your generous work in bringing this wonderful and unique product to the people! I am brushing with it and holding it in my mouth for extended periods of time in the hope that it will help in restoring some enamel loss due to years of drinking lots of lemon water. While Ive yet to see any significant change, I remain hopeful. It has reversed the early onset of gum disease and been a life saver in removing the pain from a recently erupted impacted wisdom tooth which contains a large cavity. Im soon having them all removed but the Teef powder has saved me from agonizing pain in the meantime.

A question - Would it be possible to create a Teef gel or paste that one could put in a mouthguard and wear overnight? This would greatly increase exposure to the teeth, perhaps increasing the chances of enamel regrowth. I know of only one nHAP gel available (Desensibilize Nano P) however it contains Sodium Fluoride and is pricey. As far as creating a paste, I know glycerine is out. Perhaps coconut oil or a natural gum of some sort. Your thoughts on this would be appreciated.

And have you tested the pH of Teef Powder?

Many thanks,
Michael McKee
